meanings.definition: The number or group of people who watch a particular television program or film.
meanings.sent1: The viewership for the new movie was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The viewership of the show peaked during the season finale.
meanings.sent3: The viewership at the cinema made the film feel like a blockbuster.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with viewership as she watched the thrilling scene.
meanings.sent5: The viewership at the concert was so large that it filled the entire stadium.

meanings.definition: The act of watching television or films.
meanings.sent1: His viewership of action movies was well-known among his friends.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the viewership of documentaries on weekends.
meanings.sent3: The viewership of the horror movie left her on the edge of her seat.
meanings.sent4: His viewership of classic films was like stepping back in time.
meanings.sent5: The viewership of the comedy show brought laughter to the entire room.
